name: The Small Restraint / Small Accumulation (小畜, Xiǎo Chù)

core_meaning.legge_1899_public_domain: Hsiao Ch‘u indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. (We see) dense clouds, but no rain coming from our borders in the west.
core_meaning.normalized_summary: Tension is building but not yet released. Gentle influence, patience, holding back, and gathering resources are favored over force. Power is accumulating in small increments; timing is not fully ripe.

translations.text: The first NINE, undivided, shows its subject returning and pursuing his own course. What mistake should he fall into? There will be good fortune.

lines.normalized_meaning: Go back to your correct path. Self-correct early and you avoid trouble. There's no blame in returning to what is right.

translations.text: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject, by the attraction (of the former line), returning (to the proper course). There will be good fortune.

lines.normalized_meaning: You’re drawn back into alignment — possibly by someone/something that pulls you the right way. Let yourself be guided. This is auspicious.

translations.text: The third NINE, undivided, suggests the idea of a carriage, the strap beneath which has been removed, or of a husband and wife looking on each other with averted eyes.

lines.normalized_meaning: Structure is under strain. Support systems loosen, relationships polarize, cooperation breaks. Misalignment creates friction and stall-out.

translations.text: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject possessed of sincerity. The danger of bloodshed is thereby averted, and his (ground for) apprehension dismissed. There will be no mistake.
六四：有孚，血去惕出，无咎。

lines.normalized_meaning: Real sincerity disarms escalation. Honest intent calms paranoia and prevents violence. Fear loosens.

translations.text: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows its subject possessed of sincerity, and drawing others to unite with him. Rich in resources, he employs his neighbours (in the same cause with himself).
九五：有孚攣如，富以其鄰。

lines.normalized_meaning: Trust pulls people together. Shared resources and loyalty create a network. This is leadership through honest cohesion, not domination.

translations.text: The topmost NINE, undivided, shows how the rain has fallen, and the (onward progress) is stayed;—(so) must we value the full accumulation of the virtue (represented by the upper trigram). But a wife (exercising restraint), however firm and correct she may be, is in a position of peril, (and like) the moon approaching to the full; and the check given by that to all the undivided lines cannot be great. … The restraint therefore is small, and in the end there will be ‘progress and success.’
上九：既雨既處，尚德載，婦貞厲。月幾望，君子征凶。

lines.normalized_meaning: Release finally comes (the rain falls), tension settles — but the ability to keep restraining powerful forces is fragile and temporary. Know when to stop pushing. Further aggressive advance is dangerous.
